intro: Gastrolychnis angustiflora subsp. tenella, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gastrolychnis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features include a hairy stem and small, oval-shaped fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soil.
